page.title: 01Pepper Wood, Fairfield
page.content: 30 children from Fairfield First School visited Pepper Wood. We had a guide called Andrew Thompson. The size of Pepper Wood is 134 acres. The wood grows on a clay soil which makes the bridle way very muddy. There are 36 different types of trees. This means it is very ancient woodland which started to grow 10000 years ago at the end of the last ice age. The main trees are oak and birch. Other trees include ash, hazel, rowan, aspen, hawthorn and sycamore. Also there are 12 wild sevic trees and 6 small leaved limes which only grow in ancient woodland. The flowers which grow in there are bluebells, milkwort, gorse, wild rose, vetch, willow herb, stitchwort, bilberry, buttercup, yellow arch angel, goose grass, fow glove. Also we saw bracken and moss. There are lots of insects & animals.
